discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D: Out-of-band management (OOB).


 OOB management provides access to devices even when they are:

 Powered down
 Unresponsive
 Without an operating system
 Unable to start properly

 Crash cart (A): Requires physical presence at the device location
 Jump box (B): While related to OOB, it's just one component and requires a functioning network4
 Secure Shell (C): Requires the device to be operational and the OS to be functioning

Selected Answer: D
D. out-of-band management 

Method to connect to and administer a managed device such as a switch or router that does not use a standard network-connected host as the administrative console. A computer connected to the console port of a switch is an example of out-of-band management

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is:
D. Out-of-band management.

Out-of-band management allows administrators to access and manage network appliances remotely, even when the device has not started up properly or is not functioning on the primary network. It typically uses a dedicated management interface separate from the regular network traffic, enabling troubleshooting and configuration in such scenarios.

A hybrid cloud is a computing environment that combines public and private clouds, as well as on-premises data centers, to run applications

questions.question_text: To reduce costs and increase mobility, a Chief Technology Officer (CTO) wants to adopt cloud services for the organization and its affiliates. To reduce the impact for users, the CTO wants key services to run from the on-site data center and enterprise services to run in the cloud. Which of the following deployment models is the best choice for the organization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Mean Time to Repair all the way

Selected Answer: B
"Mean Time to Repair" (MTTR) refers to the average time it takes to diagnose and fix a malfunctioning system or component, returning it to full operational status

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to describe the average duration of an outage for a specific service?

A network engineer is setting up a new VoIP network for a customer. The current network is segmented only for computers and servers. No additional switch ports can be used in the new network. Which of the following does the engineer need to do to configure the network correctly? (Choose two.)

choices.F: Place devices in the perimeter network.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B. Enable 802.1Q.
D. Set up voice VLANs.

Explanation:

B. Enable 802.1Q: 802.1Q is a VLAN tagging protocol that allows multiple VLANs to be carried over a single physical link. Since the network is already segmented for computers and servers, enabling 802.1Q allows the switch ports to carry both data and voice traffic over the same physical connection, effectively supporting the new VoIP network without requiring additional switch ports.

D. Set up voice VLANs: Voice VLANs are required to separate voice traffic from data traffic on the same network. This ensures that voice data is prioritized for quality and performance while keeping it logically isolated from other types of traffic, which is critical for VoIP performance.

questions.question_text: A network rack has four servers and four switches with dual power supplies. Only one intelligent PDU is installed in the rack. Which of the following is the reason to add a second PDU?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Power redundancy

The primary reason to add a second Power Distribution Unit (PDU) in this situation is to provide power redundancy. Since the rack already contains servers and switches with dual power supplies, having two PDUs ensures that if one PDU fails, the other can continue to supply power to the equipment, preventing a complete power loss.
